Class XYCoord

java.lang.Object
XYCoord
public class XYCoord extends Object
A class to represent points in 2-dimensions (using standard Cartesian x and y coordinates).

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    static final double
    EPSILON
    A constant used to determine if two numbers are close enough to be considered the same.

  • Field Details

    • EPSILON

      public static final double EPSILON
      A constant used to determine if two numbers are close enough to be considered the same. If |a-b| < EPSILON, where |x| is the absolute value of x, then we consider a to be the same as b.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

  • Constructor Details

    • XYCoord

      public XYCoord(double x, double y)
      This is the sole constructor for the class. It create an object with the specified x and y coordinates.
      Parameters:
      x - is the x-coordinate of the new point (XYCoord object)
      y - is the y-coordinate of the new point (XYCoord object)

  • Method Details

    • getX

      public double getX()
      Simple getter for the x-coordinate of this XYCoord object.
      Returns:
      the x-coordinate of this object

    • getY

      public double getY()
      Simple getter for the y-coordinate of this XYCoord object.
      Returns:
      the y-coordinate of this object

    • getXY

      public double[] getXY()
      Simple getter for both the x-coordinate and y-coordinate of this XYCoord object.
      Returns:
      [x,y] where x is the x-coordinate of this object and y is the y-coordinate of this object

    • distance

      public double distance(XYCoord other)
      Computes the distance between two points (XYCoord objects)
      Parameters:
      other - is another XYCoord object that is not null.
      Returns:
      the distance between this point and the input point other. The distance computed is the Euclidean distance.

    • closeTo

      public boolean closeTo(XYCoord other)
      Checks if another point (XYCoord) is close enough this point (XYCoord) so that they can be considered the same point.
      Parameters:
      other - is another XYCoord object that is not null.
      Returns:
      true if this and other are essentially the same (with epsilon tolerance), false otherwise.

      public String toString()
      Overrides:
